revised_title: Structural and Functional Analysis of Ganglion Cell Inputs in Turtle Retina
tldr: The authors conducted intracellular analysis of ganglion cells in the turtle retina and found two types of inputs: type A cells receive predominantly bipolar input, while type B cells receive a mixed input from bipolar and amacrine cells. The study provides insights into the organization of the inner plexiform layer and the functional principles underlying the formation of ganglion cell receptive fields.
